channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: ロンドン・イブニング・スタンダード紙が日刊紙を廃刊し週刊誌を創刊する計画、6年間で8,450万ポンドの赤字、地下鉄のWi-Fi増設などが原因（Jim Waterson/The Guardian）
item.description:
Jim Waterson / The Guardian:
London Evening Standard plans to close its daily paper and launch a weekly, citing £84.5M losses in six years, driven by the Underground adding Wi-Fi and more  —  Chair Paul Kanareck says newspaper's losses - £84.5m in the past six years - not sustainable

item.title: PINF調査：英国の独立系出版社300社から400社の年間売上は合計で1,860万ポンドから2,480万ポンドで、前年の3,000万ポンドから4,000万ポンドに減少（Clara Aberneithie/Press Gazette）。
item.description:
Clara Aberneithie / Press Gazette:
PINF study: the UK's 300 to 400 independent publishers make between £18.6M and £24.8M in annual revenue combined, down from £30M to £40M in the previous year  —  There has been a dramatic reduction in revenue, audience and staff sizes across the small independent …

item.title: MoviePassのドキュメンタリー『MoviePass, MovieCrash』では、MoviePassのストーリーから省かれがちな黒人である創業者のステイシー・スパイクスとハメット・ワットにスポットが当てられている（Joe Berkowitz/Fast Company）
item.description:
Joe Berkowitz / Fast Company:
The MoviePass documentary, called MoviePass, MovieCrash, highlights founders Stacy Spikes and Hamet Watt, who are Black and often omitted from MoviePass stories  —  Business stories involving a meteoric rise followed by a spectacular collapse naturally lend themselves to movies …

item.title: シカゴ地域住民1,004人を対象とした調査：62％がローカルニュースを消費するためにスマートフォンを頻繁に使用、印刷された新聞や雑誌を頻繁に読むのはわずか9％、その他（Stephanie Edgerly/Local News Initiative）。
item.description:
Stephanie Edgerly / Local News Initiative:
A survey of 1,004 Chicago-area residents: 62% frequently use a smartphone to consume local news, just 9% read printed newspapers and magazines often, and more  —  An examination of the public's interest in and reliance on local news, as well as consumption habits

item.title: ニューズ・コーポレーション・オーストラリア、マストヘッドを無料購読のタブロイド紙とプレステージタイトルに再編、news.com.auのリサ・マックスワージーEICを手放す（ガーディアン紙）
item.description:
The Guardian:
News Corp Australia reorganizes its mastheads into free, subscription-based tabloids, and prestige titles, and lets go of news.com.au EIC Lisa Muxworthy  —  Staff told some people will ‘regrettably leave our business’ as media empire is reorganised into three divisions

item.title: The 19th は、メリンダ・フレンチ・ゲイツが10億ドルを投じて進めている女性支援の一環として、ジャーナリズムを発展させるために3年間で数百万ドルの助成金を受け取った（Emily Ramshaw/The 19th）
item.description:
Emily Ramshaw / The 19th:
The 19th received a three-year, multimillion-dollar grant to advance its journalism from Melinda French Gates as part of her $1B initiative focused on women  —  The multi-year support will allow us to grow our journalistic ambitions and our audience, while investing in our long-term sustainability.

item.title: 世界6カ国で実施された調査によると、回答者の32％が、出版前に人間の編集者がAIのアウトプットをチェックすると考えている。
item.description:
Reuters Institute:
A survey in six countries shows 32% of respondents think human editors check AI outputs before publishing them; many haven't made up their minds yet about AI  —  Based on an online survey focused on understanding if and how people use generative artificial intelligence (AI) …

item.title: MENAを拠点とするストリーミング・サービス・プロバイダーのOSNが、WBD（Advanced Television）と独占的な複数年契約を結び、Max OriginalsとWarner Bros Picturesの長編映画の権利を取得。
item.description:
Advanced Television:
MENA-based streaming service provider OSN acquires rights to Max Originals and Warner Bros Pictures feature films in an exclusive multiyear deal with WBD  —  OSN, the MENA entertainment company, has acquired the rights to all-new first run Max Originals and Warner Bros Pictures feature films …

item.title: トランプのNY裁判を取材し、1月以来275回以上オンエアされているMSNBCの法務特派員に転身した企業弁護士リサ・ルービンのプロフィール（Brian Stelter/Vanity Fair）
item.description:
Brian Stelter / Vanity Fair:
A profile of Lisa Rubin, a corporate lawyer turned MSNBC legal correspondent, who has covered Trump's NY trial and has been on air 275+ times since January  —  The corporate lawyer turned correspondent is having a moment on the cable news channel, relaying all the daily drama from the camera-free courtroom.

item.title: ブロードバンドインターネットの普及と時を同じくして、2000年代初頭からアメリカ人の映画館への来場者数は減少しており、ハリウッドは値上げで対応している（Peter Kafka/Business Insider）
item.description:
Peter Kafka / Business Insider:
Americans' visits to movie theaters have been falling since the early 2000s, coinciding with broadband internet growth; Hollywood is reacting by raising prices  —  - Hollywood had a miserable Memorial Day weekend — one of the worst it has had in decades.  — But this shouldn't be a surprise …

item.title: デイリー・ビースト紙、スタッフのバイアウト申請受付を開始：情報筋：組合に加入している編集スタッフ10～15人がバイアウトする見込み（ニューヨーク・タイムズ紙）
item.description:
New York Times:
The Daily Beast starts taking staff buyout applications, seeking to cut $1.5M; sources: 10 to 15 unionized editorial staff members are expected to take buyouts  —  The two leaders have looked for money-saving measures since joining the digital tabloid in April.

item.title: YouTube、モバイルとデスクトップで利用できる75以上の無料ゲーム集「Playables」を全ユーザーに展開（Sarah Perez/TechCrunch）
item.description:
Sarah Perez / TechCrunch:
YouTube rolls out Playables, a collection of over 75 free games available on mobile and desktop, to all users  —  YouTube's “app store” for games is rolling out more broadly.  The company announced on Tuesday that its collection of lightweight, free games dubbed “Playables” …

item.title: デイリー・ビースト紙がスタッフのバイアウト申請受付を開始、150万ドルの削減を目指し、さらなる削減を計画（Natalie Korach/The Wrap）
item.description:
Natalie Korach / The Wrap:
The Daily Beast starts accepting staff buyout applications, seeking to hit $1.5M in reductions, and plans additional cuts  —  Management indicated to the Guild earlier this month that workforce reductions were coming down the pipeline  —  New leadership at The Daily Beast has begun the process …

item.title: デイリー・ワイヤーによると、2023年の売上は2億ドルを超え、黒字で終えた。
item.description:
Sara Fischer / Axios:
The Daily Wire says it finished 2023 with a profit and more than $200M in revenue, with more than $22M from commerce, most from its line of shaving products  —  - “We launched Jeremy's Razors for the same reason we launched a general and kids entertainment business and a news …

item.title: AP通信、2024年米大統領選に向けたコンテンツ共有・配信のため、地元の非営利ニュースルーム5社と新たな契約を結ぶ（Sara Fischer/Axios）
item.description:
Sara Fischer / Axios:
The Associated Press inks new deals with five local nonprofit newsrooms to share and distribute content ahead of the 2024 US election  —  - And it continues to add more statehouse reporters through an ongoing collaboration with Report for America. … - Those newsrooms were selected based …
